articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus: Latest developments around the world
articles.description: More than 1.277 million confirmed cases of Covid-19, including 70,009 deaths, have now been recorded around the world.
articles.content:
More than 1.277 million confirmed cases of Covid-19, including 70,009 deaths, have now been recorded around the world.
Cases have been identified in 191 countries and territories around the world since the virus emerged in China in December.
More than 50,00… [+2018 chars]

articles.author: Sean Whelan
articles.title: As UK fights coronavirus, Johnson in intensive care
articles.description: Tonight, the coronavirus epidemic in the United Kingdom became very real. The Prime Minister, Boris Johnson, was moved into an intensive care unit at 7pm this evening after his condition deteriorated.
articles.content:
Tonight, the coronavirus epidemic in the United Kingdom became very real.
The Prime Minister, Boris Johnson - one of the best known figures in the land - is now stricken with Covid-19.
And everyone knows Boris - or at least feels they do: it's one of the se… [+4415 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Sport
articles.title: Fury taking the positives from coronavirus isolation
articles.description: Tyson Fury has vowed to emerge as a "different person" from the coronavirus crisis and admitted the ongoing pandemic has put his future in boxing into perspective.
articles.content:
Tyson Fury has vowed to emerge as a "different person" from the coronavirus crisis and admitted the ongoing pandemic has put his future in boxing into perspective.
Fury, who has fought a well-documented battle with mental health issues, says talk of a third … [+1840 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: BT commits to no job losses due to coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Telecoms giant BT has today committed to no job losses related to the coronavirus crisis for the foreseeable future.
articles.content:
Telecoms giant BT has today committed to no job losses related to the coronavirus crisis for the foreseeable future. 
The firm said it would increase pay for "team member" workers and freeze pay for managers.
BT's chief executive Philip Jansen also said he … [+56 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Entertainment
articles.title: Aliens actor Jay Benedict has died of coronavirus
articles.description: Actor Jay Benedict, who starred in sci-fi epic Aliens, The Dark Knight and English soap Emmerdale, has died at the age of 68 after contracting coronavirus.
articles.content:
Actor Jay Benedict, who starred in sci-if epic Aliens, The Dark Knight Rises and English soap Emmerdale, has died at the age of 68 after contracting coronavirus.
In a statement posted on his official website, his management team wrote: "It is with profound s… [+1574 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Entertainment
articles.title: John Taylor of Duran Duran reveals Coronavirus recovery
articles.description: Duran Duran bassist John Taylor says he tested positive for coronavirus "three weeks ago," but he has now recovered and is feeling OK.
articles.content:
Duran Duran bassist John Taylor says he tested positive for coronavirus "three weeks ago," but he has recovered and is feeling OK.
Posting in the band's social media sites, the 59-year-old said, "I want to let you know that it isn't always a killer and we ca… [+652 chars]
